climbs.name: Wilkinson Sword
climbs.fa: 6/6/1996 by steve l, joe k chris n, dennis g, rob a

content.description:
If the rock was as good at the moves are fun it would be GREAT. Some loose stuff makes it a little hair raising in parts. This is a most unlikely route to find at Whitehorse. This ain't no slab! Steep and juggy to the top. 

  Climb the arete underneath the blade of the sword sticking out of the arete. Stay right of this amazing feature until you can mantel on to it. place a piece or two and finish up the arete around to the right.
content.protection: Regular rack to #2 cam. Careful of loose stuff when you place gear. Tree anchor (not fixed)
content.location: This arete forms the left edge of the nasty gully separating this cliff from Whitehorse proper. find the awsome hanging "sword" and you found the route.

climbs.name: Post Modern Classic
climbs.fa: Jon Eagleson and Gaeron Baker   June 2001

content.description:
Interesting technical climbing on mostly big but steep holds.  

  Climb the steep blocky rock weaving around to find good body position and good holds most of the way. Step left to a stance then climb up and left for one more deceptively challenging move to gain fixed biners on a bolt anchor...
content.protection: 7 bolts to anchor. 1 long sling on the last bolt was helpful.
content.location: Second bolted route left of the nasty gully.

content.description: A FANTASTIC hidden climb below the Atlantis area.    Climb fun and interesting moves on great rock up to a rest on the right perched on top of a cool fin thingy. Rest up and move back left to attack the crux. Sidepulls lead to a big move to a good edge then set up for a big throw to a jug and a moderate last few moves.
content.protection: 6 bolts to the tree at the top. There is no fixed anchor but you can hook up a sling to the tree and rappel of when you are done.
content.location: Just left of the arete on the left side of the gully.

content.description: A micro crag at the base of the nasty gully below the Atlantis area. Just a few sport routes on a neat little section of cliff. The nature of area is steep and shady on clean granite. The best route is Economy of Force 5.12a.
